channel.title: Help me out and post the ::emote command?
channel.description: can anyone post a project insanity emote command? i dont have one and cant seem to find one. example: ::emote 53 like makes ur character do the move

item.title: Help me out and post the ::emote command?
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:8, topic:394151”][quote author=Nasz link=topic=491336.msg3593177#msg3593177 date=1304811584]
Eh…

if(cmd[0].equals("emote")) { player.animate(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]), 0); }

You might have too modify too match your source, but not that much. Just look at like a command above where you paste this, just keep the command name as well as the integer. From my 614, so please don’t troll me :rolleyes: just that no one else bothered too really “help”.
[/quote]

Well if he didn’t insist on being spoonfed, someone would have helped.[/quote]

Commands are basic, they even have Command Generators, so why not just help the dude out… :rolleyes: + it’s Project Insanity “.”, but if you want, I can remove that post b4 he sees xD. <3.

Read full topic
item.source: Help me out and post the ::emote command?

item.title: Help me out and post the ::emote command?

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

iz3 legend:

nah its not a mandatory command infact a good portion of pi’s dont have it but the delta emote command is the same as pi basically.

Well if you know this then copy the delta command, and change the variable/method names.

item.title: Help me out and post the ::emote command?
item.dc:creator: @Meeper98 Meeper98
item.description:
@Meeper98 wrote:

Then prob just leech it off a diffrent source i looked in my source files and i dont think i have it either and im not into much of pi so thanks for explaining x), my source is not pi though so wondering why emote wasn’t in there. Yea but just use a diffrent source and look in the client.java and find the command good luck
